titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-168vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-5ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5ra-7rb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7rb-13vc) I-4) Monday (fols. 13vc-35vc), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 22rb-23rb); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree for Monday morning (fols. 23rb-27ra) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 35vb-41vc, 49ra-56vc, 42ra-47rc) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 47rc-48vc, 57ra-69va) I-7) Thursday (fols. 69va-72vc, 81ra-88vc, 73ra-80vc, 89ra-90ra) I-8) Friday (fols. 90ra-137rc), including: Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (134vc-137ra) I-9) Saturday (fols. 137rc-168vb), including: Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” (fols. 149rb-158rb); Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (fols. 158rb-168vb).

donors.donor: The name of the donor (?), written in red, was washed out in the supplication formulas (e.g., fols. 12vb, 12ra, 13vc, 69va, 90ra, 128vc). The name of Baḥrä Śǝllase is written, in red, in a secondary hand in the supplication formula on fol. 7va.

dcomments.dcomment: Late 19th cent. (?) On fol. 158rb, at the end of the “Homily on the teaching of the Fathers Apostles” (in Text I-9), a note mentions King Yoḥannǝs (probably Yoḥannǝs IV, r. 1872-89), during whose time the homily was translated (s. “other details”).

txstates.txstate: The binding is damaged. The sewing is partly missing. Some of the quires were misplaced, possibly during a resewing: quires VI and VII and quires X and XI; as a conseguence the fols. in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6 are in disorder. Most of the fols. are worn and affected by humidity. Holes on fols. 11, 37, 60, 112, 133; tear or hole amended on fol. 117.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(7; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub; 7, stub after 2/ fols. 11r-17v) – ፫III(8; s.l.; 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 18r-25v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – ፭V(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 34r-41v) –፯VI(7; s.l.: 6, stub after 1/fols. 42r-48v) –፮VII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 49r-56v) – ፰VIII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 57r-64v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – ፲፩X(8; 2, stub 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 73r-80v) –፲XI(8/fols. 81r-88v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 89r-96v) – ፲፫XIII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 97r-104v) – ፲፬XIV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 105r-112v) – ፲፭XV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 113r-120v) – ፲፮XVI(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 121r-128v) – ፲፯XVII(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 129r-137v) – ፲፰XVIII(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 138r-146v) – ፲፱XIX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 147r-154v) – ፳XX(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 155r-162v) – ፳፩XXI(8/fols. 163r-170v) – B(8/fols. 171r-178v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
One ruled line was not used by the scribe at the bottom of fols. 20r-25v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; groups of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Text I-1; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; directives for the ministers; abbreviations in Texts I-8 and I-9; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ስ፡/ ስ፡ ይባር፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፨ ይባርክዎ፡ (fols. 132v-133ra; in Text I-8) እግ᎓ ተሣሃለነ᎓/እግ᎓ ተሠ(ሰ)/እግ᎓ ተሠ(ሰ)ሃ᎓ for እግዚኦ᎓ ተሣሃለነ᎓ (fols. 148rb-vc; Text I-9) ፳ኤል፡ is used throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 37rb, 37rc, 59ra).

otherdetails.otherdetail: The correct sequence of the quires, between quires V and XII, should be: V-VII-VI-VIII-IX-XI-X-XII. For Text I-5, the correct sequence of the quires should be: V-VII-VI; for Text I-6, the correct sequence should be: VI-VIII; for Text I-7, the correct sequencer should be: IX-XI-X-XII. - On fol. 149ra, the incipit of the "Mäṣḥafä dorho" (in Text I-9) is as follows: ድርሳን፡ ትምህረተ[sic]፡ ዘአበዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት። ቅዱሳን፡ ዘመሐሩነ፡ መንፈሳዊን፡ እሉ፡ እሙንቱ፡ እለ፡… On fol. 158rb, "Mäṣḥafä dorho" ends with a subscriptio on the translation of the text from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz, during the time of King Yoḥannǝs (probably Yoḥannǝs IV, r. 1872-89); the note reads: ወተተርጉመት፡ ዛቲ: መጽሐፍ፡ እምዐረቢ፡ ለግእዝ፡ በዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ እንዘ፡ ንጉሥነ። ዮሐንስ። It seems that the original date of the translation according to the “year of mercy” has been dropped; the indication to King Yoḥannǝs may refer not to the translation date but to the time when the the Ms. was produced. - On fol. 168vb, the text ends with a short concluding praise to God, in Amharic: ተመስገን፡ ጌታዬ፡ ቸሩ፡ አምላክ፡ በሰላም፡ በጤና፡ ይሕነን፡ ነን[sic]መጽሐፍ፡ ያስፈጸምኸኝ። ። ። ። ። ።

extras.extra: - Omitted words or letters written interlineally or in the margins: e.g., fols. 3va, 8rc, 15vc, 38rb, 87rc, 127vb, 132rb, 157rb. - Erasures: e.g. fols. 13vc, 14va, 33cv, 128vc, 158rb. - Directives to the reader how to read the text according to the correct order of the quires are written in Amharic, in a crude and recent hand, in the upper margin of fols. 41v, 42r, 48v, 49r, 56v, 57r and in the bottom margin of fols. 72v, 73r, 80v, 81r, 88v, 89r. - Unfilled space left for rubrication, for the name of the donor (?), in the supplication formulas of fols. 7rc, 47rc. - A note, written in red, has been washed out in the upper margin of fol. 3r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin on the first fol. of the quire: fols. 11r: ፪; 18r: ፫; 26r: ፬; 34r: ፭; 42r: ፯; 49r: ፮; 57r ፰; 65r: ፱ ; 73r ፲፩; 81r: ፲; 89r: ፲፪; 97r: ፲፫; 105r: ፲፬; 113r: ፲፭; 121r: ፲፮; 129r: ፲፯; 138r: ፲፰; 147r: ፲፱; 155r: ፳; 163r: ፳፩.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) written in the upper margin: fols. 124rv, 129v. - Directive for the minister, concerning the mäzmur-chant of the 9th hour, is written in the upper margin of fol. 108r: መዝሙር፡ በ፱አርዑተ፡ መስቀሉ፡ …

frames.frame: Fol. 35vc: Simple, coloured (black and red), ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 47rc: Simple, coloured (black and red), ornamental band; intelaces. Fol. 90ra: Simple, coloured (black and red), ornamental band; intelaces and geometric motifs.
